page.title: 17Vandalism in Ballingry
page.content: There is a very high incidence of {VANDALISM}in Ballingry. There isn't a public telephone in use.{GRAFFITI}is sprayed and painted over walls by thoughtless and inconsiderate people, and lamp-posts are damaged. Vandalism is closing down shops because windows are broken and shop-keepers cannot afford to replace them. The store (CO-OP) windows have been boarded up. Some teenagers hang about the chip shop waiting till nightfall to destroy other people's property. In the park they damage the swings and chutes and deface them with paint. The Council has to board up empty houses because mindless vandals break the windows. At one time, people may have tried to deter them, but they have just given up and now there is evidence of vandalism everywhere. Louise, Adele, Tony, Gordon, Nicola.
